job_title: Assistant Occupational Therapist in Taunton, England
pros: Great job keeps you busy, well-being friendly
cons: Pay roll are rubbish at sorting out payment

pros:
Busy General hospital.
Polite and friendly staff
cons:
Not enough beds for when we are busy. 
Holding onto patients with medical problems as there is no other places to send them to other care facilities as they are closed. 
So bed blockers. 
Due to no beds elective patients are being cancelled so waiting lists are getting longer.

pros: The very high majority of staff I come across are very friendly. Overall the hospital is very positive, creating a good working atmosphere, meaning I look forward to work!
cons: During my time in employment at the hospital the amount of equipment problems within my department has been quite dramatic, both physical and computer systems. Without these troubles the hospital would be worth of 5 stars in my opinion.

pros: I love the fact that I am helping other people to get better while they are poorly all the staff at the hospital are so nice it really makes that difference
cons: the only downside is you have to get a car parking permit if you wish to drive to work and you pay monthly so  I get the bus to work
A little behind the times in keeping up with career developement

pros: The travel to work and staff
Great place to work, lovely staff and transparent management. Excellent career opportunities for the ones who are ready to put effort and motivated
cons: None as there is always acknowledgement of any issues and strategy which is implemented to ensure it is sorted

review_title: Is the worse company to work for
pros: Good team to work with and great support was received from my colleagues, senior workers, and some of the team leaders( who unfortunately are leaving the Company one by one in time)
cons: Overworked due to overloading with cases, you have no chance to be promoted because everyone in the management team is brought in from among their acquaintances (lack of transparency in the recruitment process), there is a lack of real involvement in supporting clients whose cases are attributed to workers, employees are treated with disrespect, they put a lot of pressure on employees, there is non-recognition of employees' merits and involvement, a lack of support from the management team, a lack of communication between management and employees, management's lack of concern for their mental health and wellbeing, and many others.

pros: I love working for SJOG. I have learned so much since joining the charity. Much more than any other organisation. Everyone is so approachable and really do care about the people the charity supports. We even get birthday cards with a gift voucher, we even got one for Christmas too.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: Brilliant working atmosphere. First class support throughout.
cons: None,, its been an amazing move for me

job_title: Gardening in Darlington, North East England, England
pros: Helpful with my confidence and strength

review_title: Not the place if you have ambition to grow
cons: very low salary compared to other Organisations

job_title: Community Researcher in Darlington, North East England, England
pros: Flexible working, support with mental health and wellbeing, colleagues are so friendly, always feel as though I can ask for help if ever I get stuck.
